SEARCH
Package kaiyuan.assignment.operations

Interface OperationFormat

All Known Implementing Classes:
AddOperation, DivideOperation, MultiplyOperation, SubtractOperation
public interface OperationFormat
Represents the strategy for performing basic mathematical operations.

This interface defines the behavior for operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Each operation must implement the apply(Number, Number) method to perform its specific behavior.

Implementations of this interface will encapsulate the specific logic for their respective operations, enabling the use of different strategies through dependency injection or other patterns (e.g., the strategy pattern).

Example implementations include:

  • AddOperation for addition
  • SubtractOperation for subtraction
  • MultiplyOperation for multiplication
  • DivideOperation for division

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Number
    apply(Number num1, Number num2)
    Applies the specific operation on two numeric values.

  • Method Details

    • apply

      Number apply(Number num1, Number num2)
      Applies the specific operation on two numeric values.

      This method should be implemented by each operation strategy (e.g., addition, subtraction, etc.) to perform the specific operation. The inputs and the result are represented as Number objects, allowing the strategy to handle different numeric types such as Integer, Double, or BigDecimal.

      Parameters:
      num1 - the first operand
      num2 - the second operand
      Returns:
      the result of applying the operation on num1 and num2
